story:
BACK TO 1 moved to backto1film.com on December 21st, 2020. Visit the page for all future updates.

 

 

 

More Brandy Productions is an independent production company founded by writer/director Doug Penikas, that specializes in the creation of feature films in all genres. Doug worked as a professional dancer on Disney's High School Musical 2 and High School Musical 3: Senior Year where he befriended the emmy award winning choreographers Bonnie Story & Chucky Klapow. Bonnie Story & Chucky Klapow will re-team with Doug to bring all the amazing dance sequences to life.

On set from left to right (Chucky Klapow, Bonnie Story, Doug Penikas)

 

Performers and athletes devote their entire lives to their passion. It’s a 24/7 job that tests your limits everyday both mentally and physically. Dancers are athletes that have chosen one of the most difficult professions in life, some are born to do it, and others learn to master it. But what happens to a dancer when they suffer a career-ending injury before they’re ready to retire? Their passion doesn’t end, their yearning to continue grows stronger, but they physically can’t continue or are told they can’t continue and now find themselves stuck and forced to find a different life. A new life no amount of training has prepared them for. They have to re-discover themselves and find a new place in the vast world.

 

Our goal with this movie is to share insight to the dedication and discipline required for a dancer to endure through physical and psychological recovery. Having a strong story mixed with original music and exciting dance sequences allows us not only to make a visually beautiful film, but a powerful one as well.

 

Synopsis – One week before her opening debut as lead, a principal ballerina suffers a career-ending injury and is forced to find a new life outside the world of dance. But when she befriends a gifted composer with writer’s block, she falls for his unlikely charm and must learn to overcome her fear of permanent injury or settle for an unfulfilling life.

Featuring over 10 original songs created solely for the movie, exciting new dance sequences of varying styles, and a powerful emotional story, BACK TO 1 shines a spotlight on the life of a performer’s emotional struggle during physical rehabilitation and her journey to closure.

The entire budget for BACK TO 1 is $5 million. Our goal of $50,000 on INDIEGOGO will cover the remaining development funds needed to get us into official pre-production. Should we be lucky enough to hit our desired goal the campaign will then become an InDemand campaign unlocking more exciting perks for backer’s allowing us to continue to make this movie properly. The more we raise, the more roadblocks get cleared, the quicker we can shoot, the faster we will get it released, the quicker you get to see it!!! We sadly can’t do it alone.

Our estimated time of completion once we've raised the full amount required to shoot is one year! By supporting us on INDIEGOGO you will get exclusive insights to the creation of BACK TO 1. No perks released through INDIEGOGO will be released elsewhere. Different marketing tools and behind the scenes content will be released to the general public when the time comes. 

 

 

You can help BACK TO 1 in a multitude of ways. Okay, actually just two. You can donate to the BACK TO 1 campaign by choosing your desired PERK level and getting exclusive updates, behind the scenes content, super comfortable swag, or even a set visit to see the film made in front of your very eyes!!! 
Also you can follow us and the campaign right here on INDIEGOGO, FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, and TUMBLR telling your friends, family, colleagues, professors, film professors, dance companies, dance teachers, musicians, MICK JAGGER, singing coaches, someone at JUILLIARD, or the NEW YORK CITY BALLET COMPANY, USC and UCLA film schools, STEVEN SPIELBERG (he likes musicals, he said so in the making of Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, true story) and every other film school in existence, someone in CHINA, your favorite STARBUCKS, COFFEE BEAN, or PETE'S COFFEE BARISTA, your acting, singing, writing, directing, cinematography agent at WME, CAA, GERSH, UTA, or just tell JEREMY PIVEN 'cause ARI GOLD gets it done, and your neighbors dog or cat to help spread the word about BACK TO 1. You get the idea. (High Five)

This movie is being produced independently. All donations will go straight to the movie’s budget allowing us full creative freedom to make the movie we want to make.

This means we will be able to hire the name cast, crew, and shoot in the right locations. In other words, hire industry professionals and pay them accordingly. 

Should we be lucky enough to reach our goal these are among the first steps that will happen.

 

  1. Music Team will create all the remaining songs for the movie.
  2. Finish casting the entire film and have our leads go into training.
  3. Lock down locations, and begin building the sets.

By then we will be out of development and in official pre-production. YAY GO TEAM!

 

 

We have assembled an amazing team of professionals from all aspects of the industry. Check us out and what we do!

 

Doug Penikas – is a professional dancer/actor turned filmmaker, writer/director. His credits include Disney’s High School Musical 2 & 3, Glee, Eli Stone, How I Met Your Mother, Elton John’s Red Piano Tour, and Paula Abdul’s Check Yourself. He produced, wrote, acted and directed his first feature film, Blood Type: Unknown with his production company More Brandy Productions which became an official selection at the Newport Beach Film Festival 2013 and secured worldwide distribution on iTunes, Amazon, Google Play, Playstation, Vudu, and YouTube in all English speaking territories. As a writer he has placed in the top ten for the Burbank Writer’s Store Industry Insider Screenwriting Competition twice. BACK TO 1 is his second feature film with the More Brandy Productions team.

Director’s Statement

 

Dance is a huge part of entertainment today with shows like Dancing With The Stars and So You Think You Can Dance. The story of BACK TO 1 shows the overwhelming struggle of a ballerina forced to find a new life outside the dance world while not wanting to give up on what she was born to do. Being a dancer, I want to see a film with strong characters that incorporates powerful themes about family, support, love of the arts, and finding inner strength on a courageous journey of perseverance. Those elements combined with beautiful imagery capturing the movement of extroadinary dance sequences set to original music, makes this protagonist’s story one that audiences might talk about for years to come.

Charles “Chucky” Klapow- is a choreographer/television personality whose work spans two decades. He was one of the dancers chosen for Michael Jackson’s This Is It concert tour. Chucky is a two-time Emmy Award Nominee for outstanding choreography, winning in 2006 for his work on Disney Channel’s High School Musical. He starred as an on-camera judge in Australia’s Young Talent Time (Network Ten), Don’t Stop Believing in the UK (Channel Five), and China’s Up Juniors (Hunan TV). Chucky spent 2013 and 2014 as choreographer for The Rolling Stones on their 50 & Counting, 14 On Fire world tours, the Zip Code US national tour, and just completed the Olé 2016 tour.

 

Bonnie Story – Is one of the country's most in demand choreographers, whose work was recently featured on the hit FOX dance show So You Think You Can Dance. She received an Emmy Award for Outstanding Choreography, along with Charles Klapow for their work on High School Musical. Bonnie's credits include choreography for the feature film Dear Dumb Diary, America's Greatest Pastime, Suite Life of Zack and Cody, and numerous Disney Channel segments featuring Ashley Tisdale, Miley Cyrus (Hannah Montana), the Muppets and both the Sugar Bowl and Orange Bowl Half Time shows in New Orleans and Miami. She has done choreography for the films American Mall (MTV Films), Rock N Roll Forever, and High School Musical 3. Bonnie choreographed commercials for the Ohio Zoo, Miche Bags and Zion's Bank. She was one of the choreographers for the new Cirque du Soliel show inspired by the music of Elvis, which is currently playing in Las Vegas at the City Center.

Thank you so much for checking out the BACK TO 1 CAMPAIGN. Check back for updates!!!

When will I get my Perks?
All clothing, and poster perks will be made once the campaign ends and shipped out as soon as possible. The POC Trailer perk will be sent directly to you once the campaign ends. The digital script will be sent out the day the movie is released. The Video Blogs will be sent to you as soon as they are completed. Since the Video Blogs document the entire movie making process (pre-production, production, and post-production) we will have one Video Blog a month. You will be notified as soon as each Video Blog is ready.  If you donated for the Screening, Scoring, Set Visit, Dance in the Movie, Associate Producer, and Co-Executive Producer perk, you will be notified about the specific dates attached to each one.
How do I tell you what my clothing sizes are so my perks will fit me?
After the campaign ends we will send a size sheet for you to fill out and return to us so we can get you the correct sizes.
What happens if you don't hit your goal?
We've decided to use INDIEGOGO's flexible funding function. Our team is very proactive in making this movie a reality and all donations will be used toward the movie only. Any and all donations will help get this movie made regardless if we hit our goal or not. You will get your desired perks.
Will Chucky and Bonnie do video shout outs?
Maybe if enough people ask nicely on our social media pages. They are both extremely busy and hard working, but if you want to hear from them we're relatively certain something can be worked out.
Will there be more screenings in different cities?
If there is a demand for it, we would be happy to add extra city screenings as a perk. Let us know on our INDIEGOGO, FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, and TWITTER pages which city you would like to see BACK TO 1 in before it's released. 
Oh no! I purchased my perk but I used the wrong information, or I moved, and fear that it won't get to me. What do I do?
Not to worry. Just send us an e-mail at info@backto1film.com and we'll update your information to make sure you get your perk.
I'm an Actor, Singer, Dancer -- Can I audition to be in the movie?
Yes. When we start casting the supporting roles, featured dancer and singer roles, we will be looking for the best fits to join BACK TO 1. Keep your ears open to the music and when casting notices become available we look forward to meeting you. Please note: There is no guarantee you will get cast. (This doesn't apply to the DANCE IN THE MOVIE perk)

We've decided to use INDIEGOGO's flexible funding function. Our team is very proactive in making this movie a reality and all donations will be used toward the movie only. Any and all donations will help get this movie made regardless if we hit our goal or not. You will get your desired perks.
Will Chucky and Bonnie do video shout outs?
Maybe if enough people ask nicely on our social media pages. They are both extremely busy and hard working, but if you want to hear from them we're relatively certain something can be worked out.
Will there be more screenings in different cities?
If there is a demand for it, we would be happy to add extra city screenings as a perk. Let us know on our INDIEGOGO, FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, and TWITTER pages which city you would like to see BACK TO 1 in before it's released. 
Oh no! I purchased my perk but I used the wrong information, or I moved, and fear that it won't get to me. What do I do?
Not to worry. Just send us an e-mail at info@backto1film.com and we'll update your information to make sure you get your perk.
I'm an Actor, Singer, Dancer -- Can I audition to be in the movie?
Yes. When we start casting the supporting roles, featured dancer and singer roles, we will be looking for the best fits to join BACK TO 1. Keep your ears open to the music and when casting notices become available we look forward to meeting you. Please note: There is no guarantee you will get cast. (This doesn't apply to the DANCE IN THE MOVIE perk)

story:
Our campaign has ended, but you can still donate any dollar amount:

Donate Here: PayPal.Me/SueHam

Please scroll this page to learn about our project -- 

WE still NeeD your Help!

Thanks,

Sue-Ham

Salon Drama is an edgy, comical, inspirational, and unforgettable stage play with a timeless message for all ages. It was written and directed by Sulondia "Sue-Ham" Hammond. (also known as Sue-Ham Baby)  



We are raising funds to bring this stage play to DVD. Our play will also premier at a movie theater in South Carolina which we will make open to the public. The DVD will also include behind the scenes footage and interviews with the cast.

  • Professional Filming For DVD
  • Premier the Stage Play in a Movie Theater
  • Premier the stage play in schools to inspire kids to Never Stop Dreaming!
  • Sell the Special Edition DVDs 
  • Donate Portion of the DVD sales to charity
  • Our goal is to have a finish product by October 2016 -- lots of work goes into preproduction, production, and post production --- We know that with your help we can take the message of this play WORLDWIDE!
  • We will keep you updated the entire time as to where we are with the project.

Below is a brief description of where the money will go and details about the stage play and cast!


Sulondia "Sue-Ham" Hammond, that's me and I just happened to be, well rather I am blessed to be an author, playwright, and director.  My body of work includes, but is not limited to The Sue-Ham TV Show, The Sue-Ham Radio Show, Flippin' Da Script stage play and I Am Who I Say I Am stage play. 

I have also been seen on several social media networks with my viral beat boxing video which aired nationally on BET (Black Entertainment Television).  I have also been featured on BravoTV hosting Queen Brooklyn's Health and Beauty Expo.

Just recently I  was selected by renowned playwright, director, and producer,   David E. Talbert (director of 1st Sunday and Baggage Claim), to join the cast for the film, "A Meyers Christmas," which is being released through Universal Pictures Nov 2016 and includes such talent as Danny Glover, Monique, Kimberly Elise, and many others!  (see pics below)

My latest creation is my stage play, Salon Drama. Because of all the requests to commit this show to DVD, I am seeking your help to make it happen!



My breath taking stage play, Salon Drama, focuses on the life of an upcoming stylist, small town girl, who has BIG aspirations to be a worldwide cosmetologist and entrepreneur. This play elaborately details the struggles Shaneka endures on her journey to success in such a hard industry --- the HAIR industry!  

Salon Drama compels viewers to never give up on their hopes and dreams, no matter the obstacles and hardships experienced along the way. It drives the message home that regardless of where you are, you can get to where you’re going, if only you employ faith, persistence, and talent.  

This edgy, thought provoking, uplifting, emotional, and incredibly funny play has left audiences yearning for an encore.  (videos, pics, and testimonials below)

LEARN MORE about "Salon Drama" by Watching the Video Below:



Film Shoot: Professional Production Company with Multiple Camera Operators, Sound Engineer, Editor, Lighting design, Video Duplication, Graphics - This is where the bulk of the money will go as we want to ensure we have a high quality product for distribution to the world.

Publicity: Designer, poster, postcards, ads, flyer service, photographer, social media, TV and Radio commercials, Marketing/Advertisement, Print

Personnel - Artistic, Technical, Production Management:  actors,  musicians, artistic director, lighting designer,  technical assistants, directorial advisor, stage manager, box office manager, researcher, prop construction, project management, admin assistant, web maintenance

VENUE Rental: Movie Theater and Auditorium 

Other:  Redoing set walls, Tech equipment, rental, props, supplies, programs, scripts, Legal

Producing High Quality Stage Plays for DVD and Movie Theaters is very expensive, but with your help I know we can do it. 

  • Professional Filming For DVD
  • Premier the Stage Play in a Movie Theater
  • Premier the stage play in schools to inspire kids to Never Stop Dreaming!
  • Our goal is to have a finish product by September 2016 -- lots of work goes into preproduction, production, and post production --- We know that with your help we can take the message of this play WORLDWIDE!
  • We will keep you updated the entire time as to where we are with the project.


    • As a part of giving back and furthering the Live, Love, Learn & Laugh Movement, we will allow up to 200 at risk youth an opportunity to see the behind scenes of the making/ filming of the Salon Drama DVD for no cost. Filming location and exact date will be determined contingent upon funds raised. 

    All donors with a pledge of $1000 or more will have this opportunity as well



    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • You can still help by sharing this Campaign
    • By Praying Good Prayers for Us!
    • Want to audition, be a crew member, make up artist, musician, etc for this production? If yes, then on your mobile device text the word SueHam to 77948 for updates and more info.


    I am so thankful for such a talented dedicated cast.... below is a video slide show of them and some of their most memorable moments on stage.




    Tonya Morman, from Community Beat, was able to capture interviews and some behind the scenes footage of Salon Drama when we opened up in Sumter, SC.





    Below are videos from the the beautiful, Brooklyn Tankard of Bravo TV's "Thicker Than Water" and classy Rose Rock, mother of comedians Chris Rock and Tony Rock.




















    $10 -  Shout Out Your name will be mentioned on my social media platforms, plus I am sending a HUGE virtual hug.

    $50 - School Access Mentioned on Social Media and 30 days access to the Sue-Ham School of Success - great classes ...see it here (www.SueHam.com)

    $100 -  Salon Drama Package Mentioned on Social Media as well as receive one of the Official Salon Drama T-Shirt and Copy of DVD - -- as well as 30 days access to Sue-Ham School of Success

    $500 -   Salon Drama Advertisement Pack * Mentioned on Social Media * Salon Drama T-Shirt * DVD of Salon Drama Stage Play * Signed Copy of Sue-Ham's Book * Recognition on Salon Drama Website ** as well as 90 days access to Sue-Ham School of Success

    $1000 -  Shipping Meet The Cast and More * Mentioned on Social Media * Salon Drama T-Shirt * DVD of Salon Drama Stage Play * Signed Copy of Sue-Ham's Book * Recognition on Salon Drama Website * Option to Attend A Rehearsal * 180 days access to Sue-Ham School of Success** Meet the Cast * Transportation provided by you for rehearsal attendance ** Phone Call/ Facetime/ or Skype Video Call personally from Sue-Ham

    $3000  -  Be In the Stage Play and More! Chance to be in the stage play -- with 1- 2 lines. * Mentioned on Social Media * Salon Drama T-Shirt * DVD of Salon Drama Stage Play * Signed Copy of Sue-Ham's Book * Recognition on SalonDrama Website * Cast Dinner ** 12 months Sue-Ham School of Success ** Transportation provided by you for rehearsal attendance & Dinner ** Phone Call/ Facetime/ or Skype Video Call personally from Sue-Ham Note: This will not make you SAG/AFTRA Eligible ** Transportation & Lodging provided by you

    $5000 - Silver Medal We will love you forever for this! You will receive VIP seats at our Screening in the Movie Theatre, * Mentioned on Social Media * Salon Drama T-Shirt * DVD of Salon Drama Stage Play * Signed Copy of Sue-Ham's Book * Recognition on Salon Drama Website * Option to Attend A Rehearsal * Cast Dinner * Special Name Recognition on the DVD and at the Screening * 2 years access to Sue-Ham School of Success * Transportation provided by you for rehearsal/Dinner * Skype call from Sue-Ham

    $10000 -  Gold Mine An on-screen “thank you” in the film’s closing credits, Special screening with Cast only, VIP status at public screening in movie theatre, Special Recognition at Public Movie Screening -- We will have your logo shown on screen in the film or worn by a lead character in the film plus website/contact info in the closing credits. Your picture in closing credits, special Plaque presentation at Public Screening * 3 yr access to Sue-Ham School-- Plus all other perks listed above in other categories!




    Want to audition, be a crew member, make up artist, musician, etc for this production? If yes, then on your mobile device text the word SueHam to 77948 for updates and more info. 

    Find me on the social networks listed below ..... Click the buttons listed under where to find this campaign. Lets connect! Thanks again for everything.

    With Loads of Love,
    Sulondia "Sue-Ham" Hammond

story:
RE:Generation

 

RE:generation is the Dance Network Associations programme with older communities. We identified that by working with CHP- a sheltered housing management scheme in Chelmsford, we could run sessions on site creating easy access for residents, enabling the project to grow across the scheme. Sheltered Housing is an ideal location for Older People’s dance classes because each scheme typically includes an accessible, relatively spacious, communal lounge area ideal for both physical activity and social interaction. Offering classes on site leads to high participation levels among residents. CHP provide taxis for residents from other schemes who wish to attend the sessions. This ensures any resident from schemes across Chelmsford can join the groups. 

Louise Klarnett runs our weekly sessions. Her role is to deliver dance content that will question, mobilise and above all offer the older people a safe environment to practice a shared endeavour. Louise offers a wealth of knowledge to support her session content. The participants have learnt about the importance of movement and dance in older age and its affects on brain and body, as well as been guided in how to adapt material for their varying physical abilities. They have experienced and explored a broad range of creative ideas as a stimulus for dance and movement, and developed their memory for movement by learning set material, often performed in unison. They have utilised a range of props to enhance their experiences and give added creative opportunity and visual interest.

 

All this is topped of with time for tea, biscuits and a chat at the end of each session to ensure we speak with our neighbours and friends so no one ever feels alone.

We identified that by working with CHP- a sheltered housing management scheme in Chelmsford, we could run sessions on site creating easy access for residents, enabling the project to grow across the scheme. Sheltered Housing is an ideal location for Older People’s dance classes because each scheme typically includes an accessible, relatively spacious, communal lounge area ideal for both physical activity and social interaction. Offering classes on site leads to high participation levels among residents. CHP provide taxis for residents from other schemes who wish to attend the sessions. This ensures any resident from schemes across Chelmsford can join the groups. 
Louise Klarnett runs our weekly sessions. Her role is to deliver dance content that will question, mobilise and above all offer the older people a safe environment to practice a shared endeavour. Louise offers a wealth of knowledge to support her session content. The participants have learnt about the importance of movement and dance in older age and its affects on brain and body, as well as been guided in how to adapt material for their varying physical abilities. They have experienced and explored a broad range of creative ideas as a stimulus for dance and movement, and developed their memory for movement by learning set material, often performed in unison. They have utilised a range of props to enhance their experiences and give added creative opportunity and visual interest.
 
All this is topped of with time for tea, biscuits and a chat at the end of each session to ensure we speak with our neighbours and friends so no one ever feels alone.

story:
What is this, exactly, Matt?

"Wireless Fidelity" is my new play about how we meet, connect, and fall in love in the digital age.  An exploration and commentary of online dating and usage of smartphones, "Wireless Fidelity" creates a dialogue about where our generation is in being able to truly connect with one another.  

I decided to put this reading together because I think the work is really relevant right now.  I think it's an eye-opening piece that really allows the reader/viewer to think about  how legitimate our human connections are in 2016.

Okay, so what do you need exactly?

I'm seeking donations and contributions to help get this reading on its feet.  While this is the first reading and a relatively unstaged version of the script, my ultimate goal is to get people talking about the play, and start accumulating funds for future readings and ultimately a staged production.  Donations can be as little or as large as you want.  

Good to know.  But, why is this play important?

This play has the potential to really make an impact on an audience.  The very frank dialogue pokes and prods at the idea of online dating, and the legitimacy of it all.  Is the connection you make with someone online as real as if you met someone in person?  Is a hook-up enough?  What comes after that?  Why is sex suddenly an icebreaker for millennials?  "Wireless Fidelity" really offers an opportunity to start a conversation about all these thoughts and the universal narrative that is online dating.  

Sounds interesting.  Why do you need our help?

Self-producing is tricky because there are a lot of expensive moving pieces like rehearsal spaces, performance space, actor compensation, and more.  With your generous contributions, I can pay these talented artists for their work and time, and have the resources to let their work truly thrive (and give you a comfy seat for your tooshy when you come see the reading!)

Aside from donating, how else can I help?

Help spread the word!  Share this page, share our facebook event, tell your friends, tell your grandma, tell your latest Tinder hookup!  You can also contact me at WirelessFidelityPlay@gmail.com with ideas you have to help!  Anything you can do is great.  

I want to attend the reading!

Fantastic!  The first public reading has limited seating, so please email us at WirelessFidelityPlay@gmail.com and let us know if you'll be attending.  Admission is by donation, so you can either make one here or in person at the reading itself.

Thank you SO much for your time, internet!  Let's make a connection.

story:
Why Should You Care?  

  •  Do you have an opinion about pervasive violence in movies, video games or comic books? Probably. And if you do, this play is for you.
  • Tribe of Fools is going to use comedy and parkour to examine the way we think about violence, who we think is allowed to use violence and most importantly who is a better superhero SUPERMAN or BATMAN?! 
  • In addition to comedy and parkour, Antihero is filled with Tribe of Fools' signature physical style of theatre and comedy.  
  • Not familiar with our style? Click here for some past examples. 

What Do We Need?

  • We're passionate about bringing Philadelphia and New Jersey audiences AFFORDABLE performances that include daring physical stunts live on stage. Past examples look like this or This or THIS. 
  • In order to do this we need to hire performers who are not only great actors but also great acrobats AND we need professional designers to build sturdy, safe sets that we can fly into, around and off of. In order to do this we need to raise $11,000 by August 23rd! 

How you can help.

Tribe of Fools wants to keep ticket prices low so that people in Philadelphia and New Jersey of all economic means can see our shows. With a donation of $25, $50 or $100, you are ensuring that anyone in Philadelphia or New Jersey can enjoy dynamic and physically daring theatre for an affordable price!

Can't Donate? 

Every little bit helps. Even $5 can make a big difference when many people contribute. However if you just can't do it but you still want to help, SHARE THIS LINK! The next best thing to a donation is telling other people about this campaign!

story:
'TV NO'

What goes on behind the screen?

TV NO is a transmedia story told through dance performance, video, and tech.

Created by BC Dance Co founder and director Brigette Cormier

Featuring custom audio technology by multimedia artist and composer Dr. Liza Seigido

Danced by Amanda Edwards, Jessie Birt, and Brigette Cormier


About BC Dance Co

Based in Miami, FL, this grassroots contemporary dance company's founder Brigette Cormier has been actively choreographing, directing, and producing her work with BC Dance Co. in South Florida since 2011. 

"I'm passionate about creating unique performance art works that tell a story and activate the audience's imagination, intellect, and curiosity through beautifully   layered movement and theatricality, from a sci-fi perspective." 
 - Brigette Cormier


How You can Help Build 'TV NO'

Our goal is to raise $2000 by April 7th, a week before our premier date of April 16th, 2016 to offset the costs of Studio Rentals , Artists Fees, and Costumes. With these costs offset,
if we reach our $2000 goal we will be able to:
  •  Offer free admission for children to experience 'TV NO'
  •  We will be able to continue offering free contemporary dance workshops to the community!
ALL contributions made of ANY amount contribute to the successful creation and production of this work!

The Impact of Your Contribution

Help build the cultural arts community of Miami-Dade! We've been sharing our quality, family friendly, original dance art works in Miami since 2011, and plan to build, grow, and offer more! Including the continuation of our free contemporary dance workshops! We're actively participating with arts initiatives throughout Miami and South Florida to provide youth and adults alike with arts and arts education!

Perks of Your Contribution

  • All contributors will be listed in our program as "BC Dance Co. Patrons"!
  • All contributors will be offered VIP before-it's-announced info on our free workshop series, for priority reservations!
BC Dance Co. Memorabilia! Magnetic surfaces are everywhere - add an "I heart Dance" galaxy or BC Dance Co magnet! Don't forget to pick your perk and provide your shipping address-

 

For a donation of $250+ you will receive this beautiful large wall poster as part of your thank you package.


The Premier

On April 16th, 2016 'TV NO' will be premiered at the Rift Blackbox Theater in Wynwood Miami, FL. Tickets are on sale now at www.tvno.eventbrite.com!



Thank You

Thank you for taking the time to learn about becoming a part of this indiegogo campaign! A contribution of any amount will bring us one step closer to our goal! In the meantime, we hope you'll enjoy watching our online dance videos and taking dance class with us - and if you do contribute, don't forget to pick your perk!
story_txt:
'TV NO'

What goes on behind the screen?


TV NO is a transmedia story told through dance performance, video, and tech.Created by BC Dance Co founder and director Brigette Cormier
Featuring custom audio technology by multimedia artist and composer Dr. Liza Seigido
Danced by Amanda Edwards, Jessie Birt, and Brigette Cormier

About BC Dance Co


Based in Miami, FL, this grassroots contemporary dance company's founder Brigette Cormier has been actively choreographing, directing, and producing her work with BC Dance Co. in South Florida since 2011. 



"I'm passionate about creating unique performance art works that tell a story and activate the audience's imagination, intellect, and curiosity through beautifully   layered movement and theatricality, from a sci-fi perspective." 

 - Brigette Cormier   
How You can Help Build 'TV NO'
Our goal is to raise $2000 by April 7th, a week before our premier date of April 16th, 2016 to offset the costs of Studio Rentals , Artists Fees, and Costumes. With these costs offset,if we reach our $2000 goal we will be able to:



 Offer free admission for children to experience 'TV NO'


 We will be able to continue offering free contemporary dance workshops to the community!


ALL contributions made of ANY amount contribute to the successful creation and production of this work!

    The Impact of Your Contribution Help build the cultural arts community of Miami-Dade! We've been sharing our quality, family friendly, original dance art works in Miami since 2011, and plan to build, grow, and offer more! Including the continuation of our free contemporary dance workshops! We're actively participating with arts initiatives throughout Miami and South Florida to provide youth and adults alike with arts and arts education!
    Perks of Your Contribution


All contributors will be listed in our program as "BC Dance Co. Patrons"!


All contributors will be offered VIP before-it's-announced info on our free workshop series, for priority reservations!


BC Dance Co. Memorabilia! Magnetic surfaces are everywhere - add an "I heart Dance" galaxy or BC Dance Co magnet! Don't forget to pick your perk and provide your shipping address-


   
For a donation of $250+ you will receive this beautiful large wall poster as part of your thank you package.



    The Premier On April 16th, 2016 'TV NO' will be premiered at the Rift Blackbox Theater in Wynwood Miami, FL. Tickets are on sale now at www.tvno.eventbrite.com!


Thank You
Thank you for taking the time to learn about becoming a part of this indiegogo campaign! A contribution of any amount will bring us one step closer to our goal! In the meantime, we hope you'll enjoy watching our online dance videos and taking dance class with us - and if you do contribute, don't forget to pick your perk!

story:
Hi, my name is Zoe Ni Riordain, I'm the writer-director of Recovery. I'm a freelance theatre director and musician from Dublin. I have been working on music-based theatre pieces since 2014. Recovery was presented as a work-in-progress at THEATRE MACHINE TURNS YOU ON festival in January 2015. Since then, Maud Ni Riordain and I have developed the piece at MAKE artist's residency in March 2015, and we are now seeking financial support to present the full production at Project Arts Centre in April 2016. Here's a little bit about the piece, who's involved, and what your support will mean to us. Thank you, and see you at the show! Zoe

Recovery

a live concept album

written and directed by Zoe Ní Riordáin

From the creators of The Well-Rested Terrorist (Irish Times ****), Recovery is a concept album of 12 songs that bring live music and theatre together. The performance uses pop songs, written from different perspectives, to present the family dealing with life after the crisis. 

Starring Peter Coonan (Love/Hate) and Maud Ní Riordáin (Maud in Cahoots) Recovery is an experimental work concerned with the idea of recovery, rituals and repetition.

Stop cooking that will you?

It’s going to burn.

You’re going to burn it

Jesus.

“…a painstaking work given startling execution”

-Peter Crawley **** review of The Well Rested Terrorist (directed by Zoe Ni Riordain) 

The album will not be recorded. You have to be here


Our team of collaborators:

Zoe Ni Riordain is a theatre director and musician from Dublin. Recently, she directed ENJOY by Toshiki Okada at Project Arts Centre as part of Rough Magic SEEDS showcase. She is a member of alternative pop band Maud in Cahoots, who presented The Well Rested Terrorist at Tiger Dublin Fringe 2014, which Zoe co-wrote and directed. 

Maud Ni Riordain is a singer and song-writer from Dublin. She is lead singer of Maud in Cahoots. The band have performed in Ireland at Electric Picnic, Body & Soul, Olympia Theatre, in New York at Mercury Lounge, in London at The Garage. Their current single 'Cure for the Crazy' is available to download on iTunes. https://itunes.apple.com/ie/album/cure-for-the-crazy/id1040417181?i=1040417183 www.maudincahoots.com

Peter Coonan is an actor from Dublin. Peter is currently appearing in the role of Jerry Devine JUNO AND THE PAYCOCK by Sean O'Casey, directed by Mark O'Rowe at the Gate Theatre. He was most recently cast in role of Toss in the feature film THE DRUMMER AND THE GOALKEEPER directed by Nick Kelly. Recent credits include the role of Marco in Arthur Millers' A VIEW FROM THE BRIDGE directed by Joe Dowling at the Gate Theatre, the role of Seán in the TG4 series WRECKING THE RISING and the role of Rory in the short film GRIDLOCK directed by Ian Hunt Duffy. He played Fran in RTE's acclaimed drama series LOVE/HATE, for which he won the IFTA for best supporting actor-television in 2014.

Set designer Ger Clancy works in theatre, film, visual and spectacle arts. He also works as an educator, lecturing in Three Dimensional Design, Model making and Digital Art, IADT. Most recently he designed a set for Me Too!' produced by Barnstorm, Paul Curley’s Bake!, Eccles Theatre The Windstealers and Brinkmanship Theatre East of Berlin. He just completed his MFA in Set and Lighting Design, graduating with distinction 

from The Lir Academy.

Our sound designer Jack Cawley is a composer, musician and sound artist based in Dublin.He has composed theatre soundtracks for:Monday's Child, Song from the Sea, The Bockety World of Henry and Bucket, The Ice Child (Barnstorm Theatre Co) Ferry Tales, Pigeon (Carpet Theatre) Pumpgirl (Lyric Belfast)Sound Designs include: CARE, FARM (Willfredd)Have I No Mouth, The Blue Boy, Silver Stars (Brokentalkers) Ten Dates with Mad Mary (Calipo)

Aoife McAtamney is a freelance choreographer living in Dublin. Aoife studied at London Contemporary Dance School & the D.A.N.C.E II programme dancing with choreographers William Forsythe, Wayne McGregor, Frédéric Flamand, Angelin Preljocaj, Sara Rudner (NYC), Regina van Berkle (GER), Anneke Hansen (NYC), Emma Martin (IRE) and Dutch dance company T.R.A.S.H. 

Robbie Blake is a singer, choral director and performance maker. His practice explores conceptions of ‘voice’ in society, as well as the forms and presentations of vocal performance. His recent work The Pink Tank uses discursive one-to-one performance to explore identity, gender and the voice, and was performed at Live Collision Festival 2015. 

Our producer Hugh Farrell recently returned home to his native Dublin where he works as a dramaturg, writer and producer. Last year he served as the Artistic Director of the Yale Cabaret, a dinner-theatre with an 18-show season. He recently completed his MFA in Dramaturgy and Dramatic Criticism at Yale University. 


Why do we need your support?

Recovery is an independent production, relying on fundraising support and box office income to fund it. We are passionate about the material, and we believe it is important to present Recovery, an experimental piece of theatre, in a year when looking at the past and how it affects the present is part of the national, political and cultural conversation. We can't make the piece on our own, so we are asking for support-this is what your funding will contribute towards: 

  • We want to be able to pay actors and the creative team a fair fee that values their work on the project. 
  • Materials for building the set
  • Rehearsal space rental
  • Insurance for the rehearsals and production
  • We are aiming to raise €3,500 which will not cover all our costs, but will be a hugely appreciated and valuable contribution and make sure the show happens. 

The Impact

This show cannot happen without the support and generosity of its contributors. We are determined to make an original piece that will challenge and entertain you. Recovery is an experiment in how music behaves in a theatrical context. We began exploring this idea in 2014 with The Well Rested Terrorist, putting an actor into the band Maud in Cahoots and using the idea of an album to tell a story.  With your support, Recovery will continue this idea of music in theatres. It is independent, original work that has feeling and ambition. Thank you for taking the time to find out more about the project, and we are deeply grateful for your contribution. See you at the show. 

*The album won't be recorded, you have to see it live.

story:
Let's Reveal The Wonderful!

www.thehonestmagician.com

Hello!

My name is Nick Lande and I am an Honest Magician. I'm creating this fundraiser because my dream is to travel and share real magic with the communities I visit. Real magic? Yes! I want to give away money at every Honest Magic Show. The money would go to Nature, Science, and Education Centers in the communities we perform in. The money raised by a town stays in that town and continues to create local magic. 

What are we raising money for? Three things.

  • 1. The majority of this fundraiser will be used this April with a free to the public Honest Magic Show. We will be featuring: www.campodayin.org.  Camp Odayin provides fun, safe and supportive camp experiences and community building opportunities for young people with heart disease and their families. I have had the joy of performing at a few of these camps and want to feature their wonderful work in an Honest Magic Show. At which we will give them money raised here. 
  • 2. An Honest Magic Show has been a part of the festival for two years now and we think it is the perfect place to generate buzz and press for a Minnesota give back tour. The fee to perform in the festival is $450 and money from this fundraiser would help to cover the fee. There is a small chance we will not be able to perform this year because the festival operates on a lottery system. If that happens all money from this fundraiser would go towards our April show and:
  • 3. Any money raised past the $1,000 mark would go towards the operating budget of an Honest Magic Tour. Currently set for March 2017, we'll need the time and a more accurate budget to plan and connect with the groups we want to donate to across Minnesota. Groups like:

    Camp Odayin www.campodayin.org

    Project Success www.projectsuccess.org

    Science Museum of Minnesota www.smm.org


In order to do real magic though it takes a lot of help.  That's where you come in:


We'll be working all year to find other sources of income to support this work, but none of the grants we'll apply for mean quite the same as a well funded crowd sourced campaign:

  • By donating you will be creating magic and opportunities with a butterfly effect across the state of Minnesota.
  • You will be contributing to a travelling message, making thousands feel inspired, supported, and entertained.
  • You will bring communities together for a night that can make a lot of difference in the lives of many you may never meet, but certainly are affected by.

Obviously there are some challenges ahead. Is $2,000 enough? What happens if we don't raise enough to give away $1,000? It's ok!

  •  A goal of this fundraiser is to create buzz early on so that come March 2017 it will be easier for larger corporate sponsors to help fund the tour. 
  •  Many spaces that we visit will also donate their costs to the give back tour making it easier to give money away while also creating excellent advertising and public relations for our partners. 

Do not fret if you cannot contribute. There are so many other things you can do to help:

  • Share this fundraiser with friends you think might help. It's really easy with Indiegogo's share tools!
  • Follow the progress and help make some noise! Your voice matters! Go to  www.thehonestmagician.com or find me on Instagram and Twitter at nick_lande

Thank you!

www.thehonestmagician.com

story:
Our Project

Hoist will be the  debut production of The Foundling’s Theatre Company’s third season, Women of War. 

In 2008, the war rages on in a basement bar in Chicago.  Skyler, the bartender and an Iraq veteran, has left everything she knows behind in an attempt to survive.  She desperately attempts to gain control over her present life, but, day in and day out, discovers it lifeless at the bottom of a rocks glass.  As she struggles with violent demons, she finds there is no escape when someone from her haunted past walks into the bar.  

Who We Are

The Foundling’s are a group of young theater artists looking to find their own home in the Chicago Theater Scene. Most of our work is about being separated from family. Since most of our company members are not originally from Chicago, it is a topic we all feel very deeply.

The company was founded in November of 2012 by then recent graduates D.J. Douglass, Robert Francis and Matthew Pratt.

 

Why We Need Your Support

As a small, emerging theater company, we need help from patrons like you in order to give our productions the level of quality we know we can achieve. Your donations will go towards costumes, make-up, props, set, and lighting. Every penny will be used to create a world within the space that is as real and terrifying as the Apocalypse can be. You would be a tremendous help to us and to the show we are producing.

THE ARTISTIC TEAM

Cheryl Snodgrass (director)

Cheryl Snodgrass has an MFA from University of Wisconsin, Madison and focuses on the development of new plays. She has worked extensively with Hell in a Handbag, directing Die! Mommie, Die!, HAYWIRE!, The Rip Nelson Halloween Spooktacular, SCARRIE The Musical, L’imitation of Life, and The Birds. In 2013 she was nominated for Best Direction of a Play – Resident Non-Equity by Broadway World Chicago for L’imitation of Life which was also an honorable mention by the Chicago Tribune for Best of Fringe Theater. Cheryl has received writing credit on POSEIDON! An Upside Down Musical, TROGG! A Rock and Roll Musical and Lady X. She has acted as “Playwright Whisperer” to David Cerda for a number of years. Cheryl has worked extensively with playwright Jeff Goode as a director, actor, and producer. She directed the premiere productions of Poona the Fuckdog and Other Plays for Children, The Eight: Reindeer Monologues, and The Emancipation of Alabaster McGill among others. While working with Jonny Staxx Presents – she developed and directed Big Top JoJo and His Towering Show of Wonders: Colossal Curiosities of Gargantuan Grandiosity for Excalibur Club. She has been a guest artist/director/speaker at Lawrence University, Hollins University, , Mill Mountain Theatre and Studio Roanoke. Cheryl is delighted to join forces with the Foundlings & Wheelhouse to bring Hoist to Chicago. Erin Lane (writer)

 Erin Lane (Playwright)

Erin Lane is a comedian, and solo artist. she has served as head writer and director with several projects including: Why the Long Facebook?, Jersey Shore: the Musical, Americans in Peril, and Obamanation, as well as Extra Rib and Holy S#*t it’s Christmas with second city. she produces the comedy showcase proxy morons and can be seen performing with her improv team, LACE. Erin has been featured in the Baltimore Improv festival, Chicago Improv festival, Chicago Home Theatre Festival, Chicago Women’s Funny Festival, Indiana Fringe Festival, Chicago Sketchfest and the New Seeds Festival in Florida. she's graduated from The Second City Conservatory, iO and Annoyance productions. Erin is currently an M.F.A. playwriting candidate at Hollins University, the stand up director for Chicago Ladies in Comedy and a member of the Dramatists Guild.

story:
Hi, we are A.N.O.N Productions, a theatre company dedicated to producing plays by, adapted from, and inspired by The Bard.

After our successful run of Hamlet in November earlier this year, it was clear that this show was not yet over and now we want to bring it back to reach more people.

ABOUT THIS PRODUCTION OF HAMLET: This production was inspired by issues raised by the He For She campaign and the desire to make the characters and issues of the show gender universal (after all, there is female protagonist of a Shakespearian tragedy, and yet the themes and issues of Hamlet relate just as much to women. Likewise Ophelia's issues can very much resonate with men.) It's set ever so slightly in the future in a highly militarized society where Hamlet is a woman who has been raised as a man for succession purposes. Ophelia is a slightly effeminate, sensitive (in contrast to the militarized society) man, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are the "Queen Bees" of Wittenberg, and Horatio is the only high ranking woman in the military (all the other roles are "gender appropriate.")

However, in order to get started we need your help. We are looking to raise $2500 to help pay for rehearsal space, performance space and our wonderful actors, technicians and everyone else involved with this awesome production.

We thank you for any assistance, and in return, we will grant you some special perks.
story_txt:
Hi, we are A.N.O.N Productions, a theatre company dedicated to producing plays by, adapted from, and inspired by The Bard.
After our successful run of Hamlet in November earlier this year, it was clear that this show was not yet over and now we want to bring it back to reach more people.
ABOUT THIS PRODUCTION OF HAMLET: This production was inspired by issues raised by the He For She campaign and the desire to make the characters and issues of the show gender universal (after all, there is female protagonist of a Shakespearian tragedy, and yet the themes and issues of Hamlet relate just as much to women. Likewise Ophelia's issues can very much resonate with men.) It's set ever so slightly in the future in a highly militarized society where Hamlet is a woman who has been raised as a man for succession purposes. Ophelia is a slightly effeminate, sensitive (in contrast to the militarized society) man, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are the "Queen Bees" of Wittenberg, and Horatio is the only high ranking woman in the military (all the other roles are "gender appropriate.")
However, in order to get started we need your help. We are looking to raise $2500 to help pay for rehearsal space, performance space and our wonderful actors, technicians and everyone else involved with this awesome production.
We thank you for any assistance, and in return, we will grant you some special perks.

story:
The ADVENTURE begins here...

Following the traumatic death of their parents, a family of children find themselves being sent to the countryside where they are to be looked after by an enigmatic Toymaker. Victoria, the eldest of the children, has great difficulty adjusting to her new life and finds herself escaping to a magical land of living Toys. So begins her ultimate adventure of personal discovery where she will learn that in order to deal with the future, she must accept the past. 


Next month, Milton Morrissey will present the first exclusive look at their brand new musical, TOYS.

Inspired by E Nesbit’s beloved book, The Magic City, and with brand new music from composing team Phil Edwards (musical arranger & supervisor for Saturday Night Fever, Starlight Express, Joseph) and Mike Sheppard (composer of film, advert and TV scores including: Poirot, Marple, Sony), Toys is a brand new family musical which will be workshopped for a specially invited audience this coming February.

WHAT WE NEED....

To help us realise the first stages of this ambitious project we need to raise at least £2,000. This will allow us to secure the right venue for the workshop, engage some incredible performers and pay for a Director to pull it all together and help make the magic happen!

In return we are offering some amazing perks - check them out here --->

WHO...

The producing team behind this are Milton Morrissey Ltd - a professional theatre company who have presented productions of some of the World’s biggest musical theatre titles, from Les Miserables in Concert to Cats, Jesus Christ Superstar, Chess, Buddy and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat. Toys represents their very first presentation of a completely original piece of musical theatre writing. 

WHY...

There are very few brand new British musicals out there. There are fewer musicals still (almost none) that have the ambition and scalability of Toys. It is a big show with big plans. Fusing Circus, Puppetry, Video Projection and traditional Musical Theatre, it is a project jam-packed with commercial potential and, we are certain, is a show that could conceivably raise the bar for new musicals.

Of course, we appreciate that this is a big risk for everyone involved. But, being that this is the ground floor of a brand new project, it is also an incredibly exciting and rewarding one.

We really hope you are interested in joining us on this terrific adventure. But of course we understand that not everyone can contribute financially. That being the case, perhaps you could help us get word out that there is a new musical in town. Shout, scream and share away. Indiegogo is a sharing tool, so feel free to do just that. Toys isn’t just about a young girls adventure, it’s also about a brand new musical’s. And it begins here.

story:
WE ARE PART OF HISTORY - BE PART OF OUR FUTURE 

For over 35 years, Studio 210 has been a haven for creation, innovation, and opportunity allowing Bay Area’s diverse artists to thrive and give back to their admiring communities. Because of believers like you, Studio 210 continues to thrive, allowing working artists to share their passions.

The Studio has given so much, today it is your turn (performers, teachers, audience members, students, and patrons alike) to give back.

With your support, we can tackle the vital renovations and improvements needed:

- New Curtains and Tracks
- New Paint
- New LED Theater Lights
- New Audio and Video Equipment (ah, digital!)
- New Seating

Our next big goal is a refurbishment of the curtains (a big financial chunk), as they have taken a beating in the past three decades. Help us start our 36th year right!

WHO IS STUDIO 210? 

Studio 210 is home base to Deborah Slater Dance Theater. Since the theatre space was founded in 1980, it has drawn in hundreds of dancers, actors, & photographers. In the past year alone, Studio 210 has opened its doors for over thirty long term renters, multiple performances, showcases, and open workshops. 

Home to the Studio 210 Summer Residency Program, offering free rehearsal space, mentorship, and performance opportunities to emerging & established artists, it is one of the few remaining affordable spaces in the Mission.

"Studio 210 is where dancers magically hide out and experiment. What is beautiful about this studio, that is different from every other studio that we get to work in, and I work in a lot of them, is that this one is somehow hidden and more contained, which allows for another kind of magic to happen. There is this sense of protection for failure and innovation, for not knowing how to proceed, for wandering in shadows, for playing the fool, for attempting the impossible."

Keith Hennessy (award winning d​ancer, choreographer, educator and performance artist)

         

        Photo:  Deborah Slater.  Pictured: Janine Wyatt, Priscilla Regalado, Nicki                      Schouela, Sallou Cole, Jan Kirsch rehearsing in 210 in the 80's.

THANK YOU ARTISTS AND PATRONS COMMUNITY 

The past quarter of a century would not have been possible without the outside help of students, patrons, teachers and others like you.  We hope you consider support for a space that has kept going continuously, serving its mission, since l980, no small feat in the world of the performing arts!

The Studio has given so much, today it is our turn (performers, teachers, audience members, students, and patrons alike) to give back.

       

      Photo:  Deborah Slater.  Pictured: Sallou Cole, Deborah Slater, Jan Kirsch, &              Priscilla Regalado

OUR CAMPAIGN

Renovations and improvements needed:

- New Curtains and Tracks
- New Paint
- New LED Theater Lights
- New Audio and Video Equipment (ah, digital!)
- New Seating

SPREAD THE WORD!  

Make some noise about our campaign through social media, personal emails and word of mouth. It is collaboration that created us and collaboration that will keep us going! 

Please join us to be a part of Studio 210's history and future!

Our priority today is to sustain a 35 year-long run at the best possible level going forward.

Http://igg.me/at/studio210

story:
Peter "isn't a girl in anyway, but quite a boy."


PETER PAN GUARDA SOTTO LE GONNE
PETER PAN PEEKS UP SKIRTS

TRILOGIA SULLA TRANSESSUALITÀ - CAPITOLO I
A TRILOGY ON TRANSEXUALITY - CHAPTER I

di/by Livia Ferracchiati 

drammaturgia/playwriting by Greta Cappelletti e Livia Ferracchiati 
con/with Linda Caridi, Luciano Ariel Lanza, Chiara Leoncini, Alice Raffaelli 
regia/directed by Livia Ferracchiati 
coreografie/coreography by Laura Dondi 
scene/scenography by Lucia Menegazzo 
costumi/costume designer Laura Dondi 
luci/light designer Giacomo Marettelli Priorelli

e con le voci di/and with the voices of
Ferdinando Bruni e Mariangela Granelli

promozione e videomaking/promotion and videomaking by Andrea Campanella

produzione/produced by THE BABY WALK

con il sostegno di/co-produced by
Campo Teatrale / CAOS - Centro Arti Opificio Siri

Siamo alla fine degli anni ‘90. Peter ha 11 anni e mezzo e lunghi capelli biondi. Wendy ne ha 13 ed è mora. Tinker Bell, la rattoppa campane, è una fata senza bacchetta ma con una polaroid al collo. Crescere. Scoprire i primi impulsi sessuali, gestire il primo innamoramento e gli scontri con i genitori. Peter “non è esattamente una femmina, ma precisamente un maschio” e nessuno sembra accorgersene.

"Peter Pan guarda sotto le gonne" è il percorso intimo della formazione di un’identità e il primo capitolo della "Trilogia sulla transessualità", un percorso in tre tappe che racconta l’esperienza della dicotomia tra corpo e mente in fatto di identità di genere.
La natura di “mezzo e mezzo”, descritta da J.M. Barrie nel suo romanzo "Peter Pan nei Giardini di Kensington", è diventata per noi una questione di identità di genere. Raramente si riflette sul fatto che le persone transgender non sono sempre state degli individui adulti, e che il disagio di avere un corpo che non rispecchia la percezione di sé, è una condizione che si origina fin dai primi anni di vita.

The Baby Walk - o Piccolissima Passeggiata, nella versione italiana - è il nome che J.M.Barrie dà al sentiero dei Giardini di Kensington riservato ai bambini.
Sentiero stretto, ma l’unico lungo abbastanza da attraversare tutto il parco, dal cuore fino all’estremità orientale e l’unico che incroci la Serpentine, il corso d’acqua che porta all’isola. Quell’isola.
Il parallelismo con il romanzo di Barrie “Peter Pan nei Giardini di Kensigton” ha ispirato il nostro primo spettacolo di compagnia. E la compagnia stessa è nata conseguentemente agli incontri avvenuti per realizzarlo.

Late '90's. Peter is 11 and a half and has long blonde hair. Wendy is 13 and she's a brunette. Tinker Bell is a wandless fairy, but has a Polaroid. Growing up. Discovering the firsts sexual desires. Peter "isn't a girl in anyway, but quite a boy" and no one seems to notice.
"Peter Pan peeks up skirts" is the fist chapter of "A Trilogy on Transexuality", a three steps journey telling the dualism between body and mind and gender identity.
Peter Pan's nature of "half and half", as J.M. Barrie describes in his novel "Peter Pan in the Kensington Gardens", had become for us a question about gender identity. The discomfort of being in a body that does not reflect ones inner identity often arises in the first years of a person's life, and most of the times no one ever thinks about this particular problem that transgenders have to cope with.
The Baby Walk is the name given by J.M. Barrie to the children's path in the Kensington Gardens. A narrow path but long enough to cross the entire park and arrive to the stream that takes to the Island.
The parallelism between Barrie's first novel and the transgender condition has inspired our first play as a company. 

Livia Ferracchiati  (regia e drammaturgia/director and playwriter)

Greta Cappelletti (drammaturgia/playwriter)

Laura Dondi (coreografie e costumi/coreographer and costume designer)

Giacomo Marettelli Priorelli (luci/light designer)

Lucia Menegazzo (scenografia/scenographer)

Linda Caridi  (interprete/actress)

Chiara Leoncini (interprete/actress)

Alice Raffaelli (interprete/dancer and actress)

Andrea Campanella  (videomaker)


Sostenerci è facilissimo!

Nel menù che compare sulla destra cliccate su Dona o scegliete uno dei premi dall'elenco. Nella pagina successiva dovrete effettuare una rapida registrazione su Indiegogo, sia tramite Facebook che con il vostro indirizzo mail.
Dovrete poi inserire i dati della vostra carta di credito ed effettuare il pagamento.
Una volta cliccato su paga, avrete finalmente dato il vostro contributo!

Se vuoi sostenerci, oltre a contribuire con una donazione, puoi diventare media partner o sponsor oppure passando parola tra i tuoi amici e conoscenti per aiutarci a diffondere il più possibile il nostro progetto.

Per qualsiasi informazione puoi scrivere a thebabywalk2015@gmail.com

Seguici sui nostri canali social (Facebook, YouTube) per novità e curiosità.

Supporting us is easy!
In the menu on the right of this page, click on Donate Now or choose a perk from the list. In the next page you'll have to sign in Indiegogo by your Facebook account or by email.
You'll just have to insert your credit card number and pay with Paypal, the best and safest online payment site in the world.
Once you click on Pay, the trick is done!
If you want to support us, besides donating, you can become media partner or sponsor or you can just spread the word with your friends and acquaintances to help us expand our project.
For any information, you can write at thebabywalk2015@gmail.com
Follow us on Facebook, YouTube for news.
